topic.title: How to Use SVG Syntax Diagrams

body.p:
The DITA syntaxdiagram element is supported by the PDF transformation. To use SVG syntax diagrams, follow this procedure:
Download the latest version of the svg-syntaxdiagrams plugin, unzip it, and copy all the folders into your \plugins folder (they all start with "com.").
Open a command prompt inside \bin and run the dita install command.
You can now add your custom syntaxdiagram element in your topic, as in the following example:<syntaxdiagram id="syntaxdiagram_ok4_c1k_xnb"> <title>CopyFile</title> <groupseq><kwd>COPYF</kwd></groupseq> <groupcomp><var>input-filename</var><kwd>*INFILE</kwd></groupcomp> <groupseq><var>output-filename</var><kwd>*OUTFILE</kwd></groupseq> <groupchoice> <var>input-filename</var> <kwd>*INFILE</kwd></groupchoice> <groupchoice> <var>output-filename</var> <kwd>*OUTFILE</kwd></groupchoice> </syntaxdiagram>
Run the (or ) transformation.If you are not publishing the content for the first time, you may need to delete the out/ and temp/ folders to see the syntax diagram correctly in the .merged.html file.
